byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Farid Farid, Hend Hassassi and Farah Samti from Tunis; Maïa de la Baume from Paris; Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome; Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo; and Tom Mashberg from Boston.

abstract: Attack on Tunisian museum that left 19 people dead strikes a blow to critical tourism industry in only nation to embrace democracy after Arab Spring revolts; Prime Min Habib Essid reports two of the gunmen, who wore military uniforms, have been killed but more accomplices may still be at large.
lead_paragraph: Gunmen killed 19 people in downtown Tunis, which dealt a new blow to a tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate its transition to democracy.

headline.main: Tunisia Museum Attack Is Blow to Nation’s Democratic Shift
headline.print_headline: Fatal Museum Attack Is a Blow to Tunisia’s Democratic Shift

snippet: Gunmen killed 19 people in downtown Tunis, which dealt a new blow to a tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate its transition to democracy.
